title: OFF DUTY --- The Essay Issue: Eating & Drinking -- Well-Versed: Ode to Champagne
text:
Anything is real

All these flowers

And I have lost my ability

To know things

Or to have knowledge at all

Instead I sit still

And sip a smooth mouth

Of gold on gold

Nothing is better than this

In the thin glass

I can see the breath

Of the thing

Pushing itself upward

Note on note of hydrangea

Or is it apple

Or whatever these

Floral things mean

Whatever the case

I can feel my head lift off

Just like they told me

It would

Someone somewhere

Is playing a silly song

I am laughing inside

Really I am

The sweet taste of victory

Is everywhere

And my heart beats in time

With a kind of unsyncopated

Nonsense

So many bubbles!

I sit and sip

From the one mouth

To another

Silly sparkly thing

Spring is a time for friendship

I toast to all my friends

Let them have a long life

A long time

To be grounded here

With ecstasy

Dorothea Lasky's latest poetry collection is "Milk" (Wave Books). We sent her a bottle of one of wine columnist Lettie Teague's favorite Champagnes, Pierre Peters "Cuvee de Reserve" Brut Blanc de Blancs ($60). This poem resulted.
